usefulItems: slice tin (16 x 26 cm), baking paper, bowl, refrigerator
title: No-bake coffee cake

ingredients.content: 2 tbsp coconut oil, plus extra for greasing
½ tsp vanilla bean paste (see Tips)

preparations.content: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh macadamias and walnuts into it. Add dates, salt, cover with water and set aside to soak for 3-6 hours.
Using simmering basket, drain and rinse nuts and dates. Set aside.
Grease and line a slice tin (16 x 26 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Place all base ingredients into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer into prepared slice tin and press firmly into base of tin. Place into refrigerator while preparing cake. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place oil into mixing bowl and heat <b>5 min/37°C/speed 2<b>, until melted.

Add remaining cake ingredients, plus drained nut mixture, into mixing bowl and blend <b>1 min/speed 10<b> or until smooth. Spread mixture evenly over base and smooth top with aid of spatula. Place into refrigerator while preparing topping. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place cacao butter into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>, then melt <b>10 min/37°C/speed 2<b> or until melted.
Add cacao powder, cashews, chia seeds, coffee and syrup, then blend <b>40 sec/speed 6<b>.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend for a further <b>40 sec/speed 6<b>. Spread topping over cake and decorate with chopped hazelnuts. Place into refrigerator until set (4- 6 hours), then cut into slices (approx. 18 slices) to serve.

hintsAndTricks: If you don't have time to soak/activate your nuts and dates, soak in boiling water for 30 minutes, then drain and use as directed.
To make your own vanilla paste, refer to the recipe on Cookidoo (www.cookidoo.com.au).
